name: Sinuscor
tagline: Advanced tool for heart rate variability analysis
body:
# SinusCor
![Tachogram](/SampleFigures/sinuscor.png)
SinusCor is an advanved tool for
[Heart Rate Variability](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/8598068) distributed
under a freeware license, which means you can download and share without any
payment. Along with classical indexes, SinusCor also allows you to analyze
non stationary HRV signals, like those recorded during an exercise bout.

The following figure illustrates a non stationary RRi example:

![Tachogram](/SampleFigures/rri.png)
##Instalation
To use SinusCor you need to download the .zip folder above and save it in
a directory of your choice. The code was developed using
[Matlab](http://www.mathworks.com/), therefore you need Matlab installed in your
machine together with the
[Signal Processing Toolbox](http://www.mathworks.com/products/signal/?s_tid=srchtitle).

###Tutorial Videos
For more information in how to use SinusCor, please watch the following tutorial
[video](www.google.com).

####Requirements
* Matlab version >= 7.9.0.529 (R2009b)
* Signal Processing Toolbox

####Platform
* Window, MacOS, Linux

####Bugs
If you find any bug, please send an email to <mailto:rhenan.bartels@gmail.com>
and the Bug will be fixed as soon as possible.
